bibl.title: Learning the Letters of the Alphabet in Byzantine Egypt (Papyrus Universitatis Cretensis inv. 5). Avec résumé en grec.
bibl.note: Papyrus acquired by the Workshop of Papyrology and Epigraphy, University of Crete, in 1998. Both sides of the papyrus were used for school exercises (Side A is a palimpsest). The text in Side A contains two lines with the letters of the Greek alphabet followed by the six additional letters of the Coptic alphabet. On Side B the letters of the Greek alphabet are partly paired, partly written in reversed order. Provenance unknown, VI-VII centuries A.D.
bibl.seg: LITINAS Nikos, Learning the Letters of the Alphabet in Byzantine Egypt (Papyrus Universitatis Cretensis inv. 5). Avec résumé en grec.

Papyrus acquired by the Workshop of Papyrology and Epigraphy, University of Crete, in 1998. Both sides of the papyrus were used for school exercises (Side A is a palimpsest). The text in Side A contains two lines with the letters of the Greek alphabet followed by the six additional letters of the Coptic alphabet. On Side B the letters of the Greek alphabet are partly paired, partly written in reversed order. Provenance unknown, VI-VII centuries A.D.
